paragraphs.content: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;

paragraphs.content: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

paragraphs.content: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

paragraphs.content: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

paragraphs.content: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

paragraphs.content: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

paragraphs.content: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.

paragraphs.content: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

paragraphs.content: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

paragraphs.content: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.

paragraphs.content: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

paragraphs.content: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

paragraphs.content: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

paragraphs.content: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

paragraphs.content: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
